node.title: World's longest Continuously Running Experiment - Pitch drop
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
**Pitch drop experiment** - Pitch is the name for any of a number of highly viscous liquids that appear solid, most commonly bitumen and this long-term experiment measures the flow of a piece of pitch over many years. It was started in 1927 by Professor Thomas Parnell in Australia.

This is recorded in Guinness World Records as the world's longest continuously running laboratory experiment and it is expected that there is enough pitch in the funnel to allow it to continue for at least another hundred years.

![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmX42JwUZZEbfgacSWJb9zuChHCnnKF3HgUcBogqbk4GQW/image.png)

More Info at [WikiPedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pitch_drop_experiment)

node.title: GST is India's biggest tax reform
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
GST or Good's and Services Tax is India's Biggest Tax Reform.  In what makes it significantly different from the existing system, GST is a destination-based tax. Currently, the central government levies excise duty on the manufacture, and then the state adds VAT (Value Added tax) when the item is sold to the next stage in the cycle — i.e. from processed raw material like rubber to be manufactured into tyres. Then there would be a VAT at the next point of sale - i.e. when the tyre is sold to the dealership and then to the consumer and so on. 

Under the new taxation regime fruits, vegetables, pulses, wheat, bread and rice are exempted from taxation even as chips, biscuits, butter, tea and coffee are attracting higher taxes. This is how the monthly budget of a Common Indian will be affected by GST.

http://static.dnaindia.com/sites/default/files/2017/05/19/576644-gstbudget.jpg

If I asked you to run 20 kms today in return for ₹20,00,000... You will not see the task of running as "hard work".

You will see it as a fantastic deal... An easy task that gives disproportionate returns.

People think entrepreneurship is hard work.

node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
George Bernard Shaw Once Said that “If you have an apple and I have an apple and we exchange these apples then you and I will still each have one apple. But if you have an idea and I have an idea and we exchange these ideas, then each of us will have two ideas.”

This is true because when you lend an idea to someone, tow people will have different thinking to execute that idea which will help to make that idea even bigger.

node.title: Please help a newbie, I’m not sure why my post was flagged or what to do.
node.author: remistevens
node.body:
I'm new to Steem, old to cryptos. My post was about a common newcomer question and how I respond to it. I used the question as my title. Someone with a lot of influence flagged my post and left an angry comment that my hypothetical was silly. I wholeheartedly agree with his comment, the question is silly. But none the less its a question I’ve been asked a lot over 5 years of pitching bitcoin to friends and family. I’ve seen Max Keiser talk about it, I’ve read it in many popular blogs in various ways. The post was nothing special, but still took me 20 mins or so to put together and comment on the first comments I received.

I have replied to the person who flagged me and politely asked what I’ve done wrong and how to avoid it. . . Although before I understood he was actually angry, I made an earlier reply where I laughed along with the flagger’s comment about my silly title. Potentially pissing him off further incidentally. Also, at first I used an image of a book and lantern from Pinterest, but thinking that might have been the issue, switched it to an image from pixabay which I know is public domain. Honestly not sure if I did something against the rules, bad etiquette, that the person didn’t like my title, or they read it fully and just didn’t like my post altogether.

Any help on how to proceed is greatly appreciated! :)


1) Should I further attempt to contact the person who flagged me and/or delete my potentially misconstrued comment? I’ve been able to see that they have moved on to other posts and didn’t reply to me.

2) Is it possible to spend money in some way to make my post visible again? I spent $100 worth of SBD on promotion that seemed to have no effect on views at all. Spent another $50 promoting this one in the hopes that some people with knowledge/influence can give me some tips.

3) Would It make sense to maybe alter my post a little and try to repost it? Ultimately this seems to me to be a bad option as I would not be contributing valuable content if I’m just repeating myself. Not sure if this is advisable and could make the influential person even angrier to attack other posts of mine.

At then end of the day I really really want to use Steem and get into it, but its tough if things I spend time on aren’t visible. I can’t even share the flagged post on my other social media sites like I usually would. Im no scammer or spammer. I’ve been writing about cryptos for years on social media and would like to contribute thoughtful content. I'm passionate about cryptos and Steem!

Thanks so much for any help or suggestions! :) :) :)

My hidden post is here: https://steemit.com/bitcoin/@remistevens/what-happens-to-bitcoin-if-the-internet-is-shut-down

node.title: Steemit Platform Switcher - a simple but useful tool!
node.author: kenchung
node.body:
Introducing the Steemit Platform Switcher

Chrome Extension that lets you switch between platforms in 2 clicks!

![post logo banner.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmPHjau3twj7E5zZ2qx42WWAM7weqDrUqQGza5b2cXKtEL/post%20logo%20banner.png)
---- I am sure most of you have heard of the following common and useful platforms: chainbb, steemd and steemdb. The official steemit.com platform of course provides a very good interface for general use, but sometimes some of us may want to switch to chainbb to look at the comments in a forum-styled view, or to check detailed statistics of a post on steemd orsteemdb.
![post platforms.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmc91BJRiCrtV5xnUyhqVAB4oJx76yb56pjdgCEwf3a1xS/post%20platforms.png)
(P.S. It seems that SteemDB and chainBB do not have any official logos. The logos shown above are designed by @stevenlwk) ---

A small trick

Switching between these 4 platforms is not a convenient task; I used to do a lot of clickings before I can arrive at the corresponding platform. But soon I discovered a slightly more convenient trick: you can just edit the domain of the URL of the current page to jump to any other platforms! (If you already knew this trick, you may skip to the next section) For example, say I am browsing this post on steemit.com, which has a URL https://steemit.com/contest/@kenchung/free-steem-mathematics-programming-competition-2-2017624t152846454z. Observe the following table to see the corresponding links on these platforms: Platform | Link ---|--- Steemit| https://steemit.com/contest/@kenchung/free-steem-mathematics-programming-competition-2-2017624t152846454z chainBB| https://beta.chainbb.com/contest/@kenchung/free-steem-mathematics-programming-competition-2-2017624t152846454z SteemD| https://steemd.com/contest/@kenchung/free-steem-mathematics-programming-competition-2-2017624t152846454z SteemDB| https://steemdb.com/contest/@kenchung/free-steem-mathematics-programming-competition-2-2017624t152846454z It is not difficult to discover that the only difference between the URLs is their domain names. ---

Our new tool

Using the little trick stated can save some time, but can still be quite annoying to change back and forth continuously. Thanks to the idea proposed by my friend @happychau123, we have developed a simple Chrome extension which makes platform switching just two clicks away! What the extension does is replacing the domain in the URL by your desired one. Now you have more time to create quality contents :)

Get Steemit Platform Switcher now on Chrome Web Store!

![post logo banner.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmPHjau3twj7E5zZ2qx42WWAM7weqDrUqQGza5b2cXKtEL/post%20logo%20banner.png)
---

How to use

  1. Click here to navigate to Chrome Web Store, press ADD TO CHROME.
    2. ![web storepng.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmfB6zbzDq7rZedFNwBW6uNUntTNy46ocsaut4MJK7ZZEe/web%20storepng.png)
  2. Press Add extension.
    3. ![add ext.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmeDm3bqcYYN27pHCx93wZe67N1tSmnAe64EpGUxhhHiiq/add%20ext.png)
  3. Make sure this message pops up.
    4. ![added.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmPpT9xxE8s7f95Af4zM41kMfv2Mk82eTZrfh7Yqa5fJaM/added.png)
  4. Navigate to any steemit posts on any one of the 4 platforms.
  5. Click the extension button. A drop down list with the other 3 platforms will be shown.
    6. ![drop down.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmYfANize7yZHDgHQDfCk7xtBmaRbzaCg2UpvoCb5hPm7p/drop%20down.png)
  6. Choose the targeting platform from the drop down menu. Voila!
---

Special Thanks to...

- @happychau123 for raising this interesting idea! - @stevenlwk for providing beautiful graphical designs! - @jesta for creating chainBB, SteemD and SteemDB, all of these platforms are excellent! ---

Known bugs

Some users reported abnormal behaviors of the extension. If you encounter a similar problem, try to switch to another tab and then switch back. This should solve most of the problems. We are working on it and will provide an update ASAP. ---

Steemit Platform Switcher is completely free to use. If you want to support us, upvote and resteem this post!

Please kindly drop a comment below to let us know if there are any bugs or suggestions for improvement! :)
